thoughts.text: Caffeine and alcohol consumption can have negative effects on sleep quality.
thoughts.reasoning: Both caffeine and alcohol are stimulants that can interfere with the body's natural sleep-wake cycle. Caffeine blocks adenosine receptors in the brain, which can make it difficult to fall asleep. Alcohol, while initially causing drowsiness, can disrupt sleep later in the night.
plan: Limit caffeine intake during the day to avoid stimulating the nervous system before bedtime.
Avoid alcohol close to bedtime to prevent disrupted sleep patterns.
